Package ui.drawing.layout

Class CentredSection<T extends Section>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.drawing.layout.DrawableResponsiveSection
        • ui.drawing.layout.CentredSection<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of section to centre.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ColouredElement, ResponsiveSection, PrintHandler, Section, ResizeHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SelectableCentredSection
    public class CentredSection<T extends Section>
extends DrawableResponsiveSection
implements ColouredElement
    Centres a section by filling the characters around it with the filler char.
    A responsive section with a stored number of rows and columns.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

    • Method Detail

      • getRow

        public void getRow​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                   int row,
                   int startCol,
                   int maxCols)
        Generates a single line of the section to be written to the terminal. In this case pad the row from the underlying section on both sides to centre it horizontally, and modify the row index / draw black rows to centre it vertically.
        Specified by:
        getRow in interface Section
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row of the section to generate.
        startCol - The column of the section to start at.
        maxCols - The max number of columns to draw.

      • pad

        private void pad​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                 int count)
        Appends the filler character a specified number of times to the specified ColouredStringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        builder - The coloured string builder.
        count - The number of times to append.

      • update

        public void update()
        Called before drawing the section. In this case update the underlying section.
        Specified by:
